definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Objective To probe into the psychological state of criminal adolescences from the single child families.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討獨生子犯罪者心理狀況。

sentences.english: PICKTHAL:The lying, sinful forelock. SHAKIR:A lying, sinful forehead.
Of this case adjudge also ring noisy alarm bell again to fictitious belongings malfeasant .
sentences.chinese: 此案的宣判也給虛擬財產犯罪者再次敲響警鐘。

sentences.english: The authorities often know that sex offenders will attack again when they are released.
sentences.chinese: 當局一般都知道性犯罪者在獲釋後往往會再次犯案。

sentences.english: This is almost impossible for the “offender” to disprove.
sentences.chinese: “犯罪者”要提出不同意見，那幾乎是不可能的。

sentences.english: Use the side of a foot to strike above a perpetrator's ankle bone.
sentences.chinese: 使用一個徒步方罷工上述犯罪者的腳踝骨。

sentences.english: The judge believed in clemency for youthful offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法官認爲對年輕的犯罪者應以慈悲爲懷。

sentences.english: And let him who would lash the offender look unto the spirit of the offended.
sentences.chinese: 讓鞭笞犯罪者的人也審視那受害者的靈魂。

sentences.english: One of the onlookers may be the perpetrator of the crime or witness to the incident.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個圍觀者可能是犯罪者或證人的該事件。

sentences.english: Wrongdoers are potential threats to law-abiding citizens.
sentences.chinese: 對於遵紀守法的公民來說，犯罪者是潛在的威脅。

sentences.english: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪者的確在迷誤和烈火中。

sentences.english: Thisis almost impossible for the"offender"to disprove.
sentences.chinese: “犯罪者”要提出不同意見，那幾乎是不可能的。

definition: to commit a crime or offence
